included.headline: Create smartphone video content with clarity | LinkedIn Learning Instructor | Guardian Masterclasses | MakeGreatVideo

biographyV3.text:
Rob Glass is a BBC-trained video journalist with over 20 years of television broadcasting experience.
Rob firmly believes that video is a communications tool for everyone, not just those lucky enough to work in the industry. Consequently Rob runs iPad video storytelling workshops around the world for organizations such as Siemens and Deloitte as well as regular masterclasses for partners such as The Guardian. Find out more at flotillavideotraining.co.uk.

included.title: Creating Fun and Engaging Video Training: The How

descriptionV2.text: Youâve been askedâor toldâto make a training video. Now you're wondering: âHow am I going to do that?â BBC-trained video journalist Rob Glass answers this very question and leads you through the labyrinth of choices. Rob has made an average of two video features every week for over 15 years, leading him to a unique multilayered understanding of why certain videos work while others donât. In this course you can explore the mechanics of video-makingâfilming, interviewing, editing, narration, graphics, and musicâwhile Rob provides tips to make these elements zing, no matter what camera or editing software you're using. You can also step back from all the intricate workings of filmmaking to take a look at the bigger picture and see how to create video that people truly want to watch.

shortBiographyV3.text: Video Trainer, Founder of Flotilla Video Training

shortBiographyV2.text: Video Trainer, Founder of Flotilla Video Training

lines.caption: - Has someone asked you to make a training video?
Wait what, have this told you to make one?
Oh that's cold.
And I'm guessing you're not an expert video maker either.
Yet, don't worry, I think I can help, follow me.
(casual uplifting music)
Hi, I'm Rob Glass, I'm a video journalist
and that means I get involved in all aspects
of video production.
Planning, the filming, the editing
and right there, those three, that's how we're
going to tackle this course.
We're going to be doing some pre-production planning,
that way we can make sure we say exactly what we need
to and no more.
Maybe just lose that bottom bit, better.
And then we'll take a look at production.
We won't take a deep dive into every camera you could use,
we've got other courses for that.
But we will take a look at how to keep your shots
steady and level.
Finally, we'll sew up all our loose ends in post-production,
so our training videos always look jaw-droppingly good.
Maybe just a close-up there, superb.
So whether you're on your own or part of a team,
the important thing is to create engaging video
for your learners.
But most of all have some fun because when you're having fun
your audience is having fun, isn't that right?!
(cheering)
Yes.
(casual uplifting music)

descriptionV2.text: Explore what we'll be covering in this course, including pre-production, production, and post-production.

descriptionV3.text: Explore what we'll be covering in this course, including pre-production, production, and post-production.
